metadata.title: CVE-2023-39323 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
Line directives ("//line") can be used to bypass the restrictions on"//go:cgo_" directives, allowing blocked linker and compiler flags to bepassed during compilation. This can result in unexpected execution ofarbitrary code when running "go build". The line directive requires theabsolute path of the file in which the directive lives, which makesexploiting this issue significantly more complex.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-39323` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.20 - 1.20.3-1ubuntu0.2
golang-1.20-go - 1.20.3-1ubuntu0.2
golang-1.20-src - 1.20.3-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-1.19 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.20 package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.20.3-1ubuntu0.2').
